title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7903.4 - Issuance of general distribution orders
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7903.4 - Issuance of general distribution orders

State Regulations
(a) Upon determining that a general
distribution order should be issued pursuant to Part 7902 of this subchapter, the State Energy Office shall issue one or more general distribution orders. Each order shall name the prime supplier required to make a general
distribution, and specify the type and volume of fuel to be distributed, the
class of trade to receive distribution, and the geographical area designated as
suffering from an intra-State supply imbalance, if any, within which
distribution is to be made. If a general distribution order does not specify
any class of trade or geographical area, it requires that a general
distribution be made to all classes and areas in the State normally supplied by
the prime supplier. (b) The order
shall include a brief statement summarizing the basis upon which the order is
issued. The order shall provide that any person aggrieved thereby may file an
appeal with the State Energy Office in accordance with Part 7904 of this
subchapter. (c) The order shall
state that it is effective upon issuance. (d) The State Energy Office shall serve a
copy of the order by telegram, telex, or telecopier upon the designated State
representative of the prime supplier. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9

7903.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
